file_content.text: May the Force ever serve you.
It's Darth Arkous you ought to be addressing.
Truth is, I have great deal to say. Now that we're alone, we can have a real dialogue.
This is Lana Beniko. I need you to meet with me--somewhere private. You may be the Empire's only hope.
Why don't you start by telling me a little bit more about yourself?
Let's talk about you.
Then start talking.
Get right to the point.
Darth Arkous wouldn't appreciate you going behind his back like this.
You distrust Arkous?
Oh. What is it you want to know?
What wouldn't I want to know? You fascinate me.
[Flirt] Everything.
You're unusual for a Sith. You don't even have a title.
Why not "Lord Beniko"?
How did you end up as advisor to Darth Arkous?
Tell me about you and Arkous.
No, I don't imagine he would--especially considering what I have to say...
Darth Arkous wasn't entirely forthcoming about his reasons for invading the Jedi Temple--not even with me. He was after a very specific item. An artifact.
Knowledge, answers, truth, the Force: these are the things I hold dear. Titles don't interest me.
Considering the places you've gone, all you must have seen, I'm flattered that you would feel that way.
I wanted to better understand war, so I asked to be posted with him. Over time, he came to trust my opinion, so here I am.
Can we...? Sorry, I don't mean to appear antisocial, but I do have pressing concerns....
What sort of artifact? A holocron, a device, some ancient weapon? The less I'm in the dark, the better I can understand Arkous' motivations.
Tell me more.
I overheard Arkous talking to Goh. It did seem like they had some ulterior motive.
I knew something was off.
We were successful on Tython. The Republic was humiliated. The rest is irrelevant.
So?
I wish I could say. Whatever it is, Darth Arkous was in a rage with Lord Goh until he found it. And there's more.
If the full scope of the issue ended with Tython, that might be true.
If I knew more, I could determine what that motive is. There's very good reason to be concerned about it.
Meaning?
I now believe that the Republic's attack on Korriban wasn't a retaliation for Tython. It was intended to coincide with our own attack.
Major offensives coordinated across two warring militaries? I'm not saying it's impossible, but it's close.
Highly unlikely.
Attacking Korriban while the Empire still held the Jedi Temple didn't make much sense to me at the time. It still doesn't.
It did seem odd....
And you think that has something to do with what Darth Arkous is up to?
Are you accusing Arkous?
It is a stretch, but these attacks occurred nearly on top of one another, and that cannot be a coincidence. It's all making sense now....
I'm his advisor; he's meant to confide in me. He used to, but not anymore. I fear I may now begin to understand why....
You're of great importance to the Empire, yet you exist outside of it. Hunter... I can't think of anyone better suited to be on my side right now.
There's something in the Force that I've never felt before. It exists nowhere and everywhere at once. Writhing, growing.
I should sense that as well. Are you sure?
Someone like you, Commander--most would never trust you. But you're practically the only one I trust right now. Help me unravel this mystery.
I think I sense this "growth" because I'm tied to it somehow, maybe by association to Darth Arkous. I think.... I think the Empire's in terrible danger.
That sounds ominous....
I'm far from weak, but I'm only one Sith. Whatever's coming, I can't stop it alone, Wrath.
I'm used to offering my counsel to others... now I turn to you for yours, Dark Lord. Will you help me?
Nor should it--not from our current vantage point. But a wider context may exist that could explain recent events....
You say you "sense something" and all but accuse Darth Arkous of plotting against the Empire, and I'm supposed to just believe you?
I don't trust you.
I knew I could count on you. I felt it.
If my word isn't enough, I suppose I'll have to prove it to you.
Potential rogue operatives. Galactic repercussions. You've got yourself an ally.
Intriguing. I'll do it.
Sounds like you've got a heap of trouble in your future. Turns out I happen to like trouble.
Could be dangerous. I'm in.
I did not join the Dark Council to stand idly by while the Empire crumbles around me.
I will. The Empire won't fall.
Anyone conspiring against the Empire will answer to me and suffer for their foolishness.
I will stop it.
You won't have to; you have me.
[Flirt] I'll stand with you.
Whatever you require, you only need but ask, and I will make it so.
[Flirt] Anything for you.
You can't think of anyone better 'cause there isn't. But you already know that, don't you?
[Flirt] Got that right.
Can't think of anyone else I'd rather do some unraveling with.
[Flirt] We'll make a good team.
Thank you, my lord.
You came. Good.
I'm aware I've been somewhat quiet following your success on Tython. Don't mistake my reticence for apathy.
I suppose I do....
I'll see if I can't make sense of what happened on Tython and Korriban and what all of this means.
Whatever I find, I'll let you know as soon as I can. Stay vigilant, and may the Force ever serve you.
Is that right...?
Well. I'm afraid there's nothing for us to act on just yet. I'll keep my eyes and ears open; you do the same.
I have to be at Arkous' side now, but I'll remain in touch. I promise.
